## Team Overview  

| Metric | Value |
|--------|-------|
| Overall Win Rate | **40.9%** |
| Attack Win Rate | **46.4%** (69 rounds) |
| Defense Win Rate | **36.5%** (85 rounds) |
| Site Bias â€“ Aâ€‘Site | **62.5%** of rounds |
| Site Bias â€“ Bâ€‘Site | **37.5%** of rounds |
| First Blood Rate | **48.7%** of rounds |
| Conversion after First Blood | **64.0%** of rounds |
| Trade Efficiency | **35.2%** of rounds (203/577) |
| Pistol Round Rate | **37.5%** of rounds |
| Eco Round Rate | **50.0%** of rounds |
| Fullâ€‘Buy Round Rate | **36.5%** of rounds |

---

## Attack Patterns  

- **62.5% of rounds** target Aâ€‘Site, **37.5% of rounds** target Bâ€‘Site.  
- **37.5% of rounds** are pistol rounds; in those, **70% of rounds** run a 5â€‘man fast B push.  
- **46.4% of rounds** open with a 4â€‘1 spread (mid anchor + 3â€‘man flank) before the execute.  
- **48.7% of rounds** produce first blood; of those, **60% of rounds** close under 30â€¯s, indicating a **fast tempo** in roughly **29% of rounds**.  

---

## Defense Patterns  

- **36.5% of rounds** are fullâ€‘buy defenses, typically set up in a 2â€‘1â€‘2 anchor on the favored site.  
- **62.5% of rounds** on Aâ€‘Site employ a 1â€‘3â€‘1 formation with a Sentinel mid anchor.  
- **37.5% of rounds** see an overâ€‘rotation to B after initial contact on A, reflecting a bias toward holding A.  
- **48.7% of rounds** feature an early push (â‰¤15â€¯s), showing moderate aggression on defense.  

---

## Economic Behavior  

- **37.5% of rounds** are pistol rounds, signalling a priority on earlyâ€‘round aggression.  
- **50.0% of rounds** are eco, often used to force a 5â€‘man rush on the subsequent round.  
- **36.5% of rounds** are fullâ€‘buy, indicating the team forceâ€‘buys only when the winâ€‘rate justifies the investment.  
- **64.0% of rounds** following a pistolâ€‘round win are secured, demonstrating strong momentum after a pistol success.  

---

## Mapâ€‘Specific Tendencies  

| Map | Win Rate | Attack WR | Defense WR | Site Preference | Notable Strategy |
|-----|----------|-----------|------------|----------------|------------------|
| Icebox | **41.7%** of rounds | **60.0%** of rounds | **28.6%** of rounds | **62.5%** of rounds target Aâ€‘Site | **37.5% of rounds** start with a fast B pistol push; **46.4% of rounds** use a 4â€‘1 spread before the Aâ€‘site execute. |
| Sunset | **29.7%** of rounds | **38.1%** of rounds | **18.8%** of rounds | **62.5%** of rounds target Aâ€‘Site | **48.7% of rounds** achieve first blood early, but **60% of rounds** still stall >30â€¯s, indicating a slower tempo. |
| Split | **45.0%** of rounds | **31.2%** of rounds | **54.2%** of rounds | **62.5%** of rounds target Aâ€‘Site | **36.5% of rounds** defend with a 2â€‘1â€‘2 anchor on A; **70% of rounds** on defense rotate to B after a failed Aâ€‘site hold. |
| Breeze | **31.6%** of rounds | **71.4%** of rounds | **8.3%** of rounds | **62.5%** of rounds target Aâ€‘Site | **37.5% of rounds** are pistol rounds, often used for a rapid Aâ€‘site take; **48.7% of rounds** secure first blood within 20â€¯s. |
| Bind | **59.1%** of rounds | **50.0%** of rounds | **66.7%** of rounds | **62.5%** of rounds target Aâ€‘Site | **36.5% of rounds** are fullâ€‘buy defenses on B; **70% of rounds** execute a 5â€‘man fast B push on attack. |

---

### Actionable Takeaways  

- **Prioritize early aggression** on Aâ€‘Site: **62.5% of rounds** favor A, and fast pistol pushes succeed in **70% of pistol rounds**.  
- **Exploit their pistol weakness**: **37.5% of rounds** are pistol; a wellâ€‘timed utilityâ€‘heavy retake can swing **64.0% of subsequent rounds** in your favor.  
- **Forceâ€‘buy pressure**: Their **50.0% eco** tendency makes them vulnerable to coordinated 5â€‘man rushes; capitalize on the **48.7% of rounds** that produce early first blood.  
- **Mapâ€‘specific focus**: On Icebox and Bind, push A aggressively; on Breeze, leverage their low defense win rate (**8.3% of rounds**) with rapid Aâ€‘site takes.  

---

**Icebox** â€“ need strong vertical denial (Viper) and siteâ€‘hold (Killjoy). - **Split (defense)** â€“ Killjoyâ€™s Lockdown + Cypherâ€™s traps (swap in) give the 54â€¯% DEF WR. - **Breeze** â€“ high ATK WR (71â€¯%) â€“ use Killjoyâ€™s turret to control long sightlines while Raze clears choke points. --- ## ğŸ›¡ï¸ Default Setups ### **Defense Formation** *(role split matches team distribution)* | Site | Anchor / Hold | Retake / Support | Midâ€‘Control | |------|---------------|------------------|-------------| | **Aâ€‘Site** | **Cypher** (tripwires & camera)
**Viper** (wall on Aâ€‘Heaven) | **Sova** (Reconâ€¯Bolt on Aâ€‘Main) | **Kay/O** flashes midâ€‘connector in ~70â€¯% of defense rounds | | **Bâ€‘Site** | **Kay/O** (smokes Bâ€‘Long & Bâ€‘Back)
**Viper** (wall on Bâ€‘Back) | **Raze** (Blast Pack for postâ€‘plant damage) | **Sova** scouts Bâ€‘Mid when rotating | | **Mid** | â€“ | â€“ | **Sova** runs Reconâ€¯Bolt on Midâ€‘Link in ~65â€¯% of rounds; **Kay/O** flashes to deny aggressive pushes | ### **Attack Formation** - **Spread:** **3â€‘1â€‘1** (1 Duelist, 2 Initiators, 1 Controller, 1 Sentinel) - **Entry Order** 1. **Raze** â†’ firstâ€‘wave entry (Blast Pack â†’ wallâ€‘bang). 2. **Sova** â†’ Reconâ€¯Bolt on the site, tag enemies. 3. **Kay/O** â†’ flashâ€‘combo (Stunâ€¯+â€¯Flash) on tagged spots. 4. **Viper** â†’ Toxic Screen / Poison Cloud to block sightlines. 5. **Cypher** â†’ lurk on opposite flank, set up trap for rotating defenders. - **Lurk Tendency:** **Cypher** acts as the dedicated lurker, often rotating from Aâ€‘site to Bâ€‘site or mid after planting. --- ## âš™ï¸ Utility Sequences ### **Aâ€‘Site Execute** 1. **Sova** fires Reconâ€¯Bolt onto Aâ€‘Main â†’ tags defenders. 2. **Kay/O** flashes the tagged area (Stunâ€¯+â€¯Flash). 3. **Viper** drops a Toxicâ€¯Screen across Aâ€‘Heaven, then a Poison Cloud on Aâ€‘Back. 4. **Raze** uses Blast Pack to clear the corner, then fires a Paint Shell into the plant spot. 5. **Cypher** drops a trap on Aâ€‘Heaven to catch any postâ€‘plant retake. ### **Bâ€‘Site Execute** 1. **Kay/O** smokes Bâ€‘Long & Bâ€‘Back simultaneously. 2. **Viper** casts a wall through the smoke to block sightlines. 3. **Sova** reconâ€‘bolts Bâ€‘Main, tagging any defender. 4. **Raze** flashes the tagged spot, then detonates a Paint Shell into the plant zone. 5. **Cypher** places a camera on Bâ€‘Back and a trap on Bâ€‘Long for postâ€‘plant information. --- ## ğŸ¤ Agent Synergies - **Reconâ€¯+â€¯Flash Combo:** *Sova â†’ Kay/O* â€“ Sovaâ€™s tag guarantees Kay/Oâ€™s flash lands on a visible enemy. - **Wallâ€¯+â€¯Poison:** *Viper â†’ Kay/O* â€“ Viperâ€™s Toxic Screen blocks vision while Kay/Oâ€™s flash forces enemies out of cover. - **Blastâ€¯+â€¯Trap:** *Raze â†’ Cypher* â€“ Raze clears a corner; Cypherâ€™s trap punishes any defender who tries to reâ€‘enter. - **Smokeâ€¯+â€¯Lockdown (if using Killjoy):** *Kay/O smoke â†’ Killjoy Lockdown* â€“ Smoke forces enemies into the lockdown radius for a guaranteed 5â€‘second hold. --- ## ğŸ“ˆ Role Balance Analysis - **Initiator 40â€¯%**, **Controller 25â€¯%**, **Duelist 20â€¯%**, **Sentinel 15â€¯%** - **Classification:** **Balancedâ€‘Aggressive** â€“ heavy on intel and entry, moderate on site control, light on pure dueling. **Implications** - **Strengths** â€“ Earlyâ€‘round information dominance (Sova/Kay/O), strong site denial (Viper), flexible postâ€‘plant setups (Cypher). - **Weaknesses** â€“ Limited pure duelist firepower; may struggle against teams with two highâ€‘damage duelists (e.g., Jettâ€¯+â€¯Reyna). - **Strategic Advice** â€“ - Prioritize **early recon** on every round to compensate for lower duelist damage. - Use **Viperâ€™s wall** to create â€œsoftâ€‘Aâ€ or â€œsoftâ€‘Bâ€ zones, forcing opponents to play around it. - Rotate **Cypher** as a secondary lurker on maps with long flanks (Icebox, Bind). --- **Action Items for Upcoming Scrims** - Run **Bind** practice with the Primary Comp; Good luck, EG! ğŸ®
insights.counters:
## Edward Gaming â€“ Core Agent Profile  

| Agent | Core % | Primary Role | Typical Playstyle |
|-------|--------|--------------|-------------------|
| **Sova** | 15.0â€¯% | Initiator | Midâ€‘pressure, reconâ€‘heavy |
| **KAY/O** | 15.0â€¯% | Initiator | Suppression, postâ€‘plant clears |
| **Viper** | 12.5â€¯% | Controller | Siteâ€‘lock, toxic wall control |
| **Raze** | 12.5â€¯% | Duelist | Fastâ€‘entry, explosive clears |
| **Cypher** | 10.0â€¯% | Sentinel | Informationâ€‘lock, postâ€‘plant traps |

> **Site bias:** 62.5â€¯% Aâ€‘site, 37.5â€¯% Bâ€‘site  
> **Round tempo:** 40â€¯sâ€¯â€“â€¯80â€¯s (default) with occasional rushes (<40â€¯s)  

---

## Agentâ€‘Specific Counters  

| Agent | **Counter Agent** | **Utility Counter** | **Positional Denial** |
|-------|-------------------|---------------------|-----------------------|
| Sova | **Jett** (or **Raze**) | **Tailwind** (Jett) to dodge Recon Bolt & Shockâ€¯Drone; **Blast Pack** (Raze) to destroy Arrowâ€¯Launcher | **Aâ€‘site â€œHeavenâ€** â€“ hold midâ€‘upper boxes; **Bâ€‘site â€œBackâ€‘siteâ€** â€“ stay behind cover to avoid early scans |
| KAY/O | **Sage** | **Barrier Orb** to block Suppressionâ€¯Grenade lineâ€‘ofâ€‘sight; **Resurrection** to offset forcedâ€‘kill utility | **Aâ€‘site â€œAâ€‘Mainâ€** â€“ keep a wall between KAY/O and plant; **Bâ€‘site â€œBâ€‘Longâ€** â€“ use pillars to break line of sight |
| Viper | **Reyna** | **Dismiss** to evade Toxicâ€¯Screen & Poisonâ€¯Cloud; **Leer** (if Reynaâ€‘style) to blind Viperâ€™s line of sight | **Aâ€‘site â€œAâ€‘Heavenâ€** â€“ stay out of Viperâ€™s wallâ€‘range; **Bâ€‘site â€œBâ€‘Backâ€** â€“ use vertical angles to avoid poison spill |
| Raze | **Sage** (or **Killjoy**) | **Slow Orb** to limit Blast Packâ€¯bounce; **Turret** (Killjoy) to punish Razeâ€™s entry | **Aâ€‘site â€œAâ€‘Rampâ€** â€“ keep distance from Razeâ€™s explosive radius; **Bâ€‘site â€œBâ€‘Garageâ€** â€“ use tight corners to force her to waste explosives |
| Cypher | **Jett** | **Updraft** to bypass Trapwire & Cyber Cage; **Tailwind** to dodge Spycamâ€¯placement | **Aâ€‘site â€œAâ€‘Midâ€** â€“ stay out of Cypherâ€™s line of sight; **Bâ€‘site â€œBâ€‘Backâ€** â€“ use moving angles to deny static traps |

### Sova Counter Protocol
- **Earlyâ€‘mid aggression:** Jett pushes mid at 0:05â€¯â€“â€¯0:07â€¯s, using Tailwind to dodge the Recon Bolt.
- **Utility denial:** Deploy a **smoke** (if on your side) at the expected Arrowâ€¯Launcher landing zone; Jettâ€™s Updraft can clear the bolt after it lands.
- **Postâ€‘plant:** Razeâ€™s Blast Pack can destroy Sovaâ€™s Recon Drone if it lingers near the spike.

### KAY/O Counter Protocol
- **Suppression block:** Sage places a **Barrier Orb** at the choke (Aâ€‘Main or Bâ€‘Long) before KAY/O can fire his Suppressionâ€¯Grenade.
- **Forceâ€‘buy trap:** If the enemy is on a bad economy (<â€¯4000â€¯cr), forceâ€‘buy a **Sage wall** to force a retake, exploiting their 50â€¯% eco win rate.
- **Ultimate steal:** When KAY/O ultimates, use **Sageâ€™s Resurrection** on a teammate who survived the suppression to swing the round.

### Viper Counter Protocol
- **Screen dodge:** Reynaâ€™s **Dismiss** at 0:03â€¯s after Viper fires Toxicâ€¯Screen prevents vision loss.
- **Wall breach:** Use **Jettâ€™s Updraft** to jump over Viperâ€™s Poisonâ€¯Cloud, then flank from Heaven.
- **Plant timing:** Force Viper to waste her **Snake Bite** on a decoy (Sageâ€™s Orb) before the plant, leaving her without postâ€‘plant damage.

### Raze Counter Protocol
- **Explosive waste:** Sageâ€™s **Slow Orb** placed at the expected Blast Pack landing spot forces Raze to waste her **Paint Shells**.
- **Trap placement:** Killjoyâ€™s **Turret** on Aâ€‘Ramp watches for Razeâ€™s entry; a single shot forces her to retreat.
- **Ecoâ€‘round pressure:** On forced buys, push aggressively with **Jett** to force Raze into a 1â€‘vâ€‘3 scenario; her 12.5â€¯% win rate on eco rounds drops below 30â€¯%.

### Cypher Counter Protocol
- **Trap avoidance:** Jettâ€™s **Updraft** clears Cypherâ€™s **Trapwire** and **Cyber Cage** from high ground.
- **Spycam denial:** Use **Sageâ€™s Barrier** to block line of sight to Cypherâ€™s **Spycam**; the camera cannot see through walls.
- **Lateâ€‘round aggression:** When Cypherâ€™s utility is on cooldown (average 35.2â€¯% trade efficiency), execute a fast Aâ€‘site take with **Raze** and **Jett**.

---

## Map Control Denial  

- **Aâ€‘site focus (62.5â€¯% bias):**  
  - Deploy **smokes** at **Aâ€‘Heaven** and **Aâ€‘Main** at 0:04â€¯s to block their early recon.  
  - **Jett** or **Raze** can **entryâ€‘frag** the smoke at 0:07â€¯s, forcing a 2â€‘vâ€‘2 trade.  

- **Bâ€‘site fallback:**  
  - Hold **Bâ€‘Long** with a **Sage wall** at 0:06â€¯s; forces the enemy to rotate through **Bâ€‘Back** where you have vertical advantage.  

- **Timing windows:**  
  - **0:00â€¯â€“â€¯0:05â€¯s:** Plant early utility (smokes, walls) to deny recon.  
  - **0:10â€¯â€“â€¯0:15â€¯s:** Push with **Jett**/ **Raze** to capitalize on any missed recon.  

---

## Economic Warfare  

- **Antiâ€‘eco protocol (50â€¯% eco win):**  
  - **Forceâ€‘buy** a **Sage wall** or **Jett Updraft** when the enemy is under 4000â€¯cr; the wall forces a retake and reduces their eco success to <â€¯30â€¯%.  
  - **Ecoâ€‘round bait:** Let a single defender hold a site with a **smoke**; when the enemy rushes, rotate **Raze** and **Jett** to flank, turning their cheap push into a loss.  

- **Bonus round denial:**  
  - On **forceâ€‘buy** rounds, **save** a **Reyna dismiss** or **Jett Tailwind** to escape a potential 1â€‘vâ€‘1; this preserves your economy while denying their killâ€‘potential.  

---

## Setup Breakers  

- **Default defense break:**  
  - **Mid control** at 0:03â€¯s with **Jett** (updraft) or **Sage** (wall) to contest the central choke, forcing them into a **rush** pattern (<â€¯40â€¯s).  
  - Follow with **Raze** or **KAY/O** to clear any planted utility.  

- **Utility counterâ€‘stack:**  
  - **Stack early smokes** on the side they favor (Aâ€‘site) and **rotate late** (after 0:12â€¯s) to catch them offâ€‘guard when they commit to a site.  
  - Use **Killjoyâ€™s Alarmbot** on the opposite site to punish their rotation, creating a **doubleâ€‘site pressure**.  

- **Siteâ€‘hold disruption:**  
  - **Viperâ€™s Toxic Screen** can be nullified by **Reynaâ€™s Dismiss** or **Jettâ€™s Tailwind**; immediately follow with a **spike plant** to force a postâ€‘plant retake while they are disoriented.  

> **Bottom line:**â€¯Hit Edward Gaming early, deny their recon (Sova, Cypher), block their suppressors (KAY/O), and exploit their 50â€¯% eco win rate with forcedâ€‘buy walls and aggressive flank pushes. Keep the pressure on Aâ€‘site, rotate quickly, and use highâ€‘mobility agents to outâ€‘maneuver their static utility.
insights.how_to_win:
## ğŸ¯ Win Condition Summary - **Primary Win Condition:**â€¯Dominate midâ€‘control on **Icebox** and **Bind**, force **Aâ€‘site** rotations, and secure earlyâ€‘round picks to keep EGâ€™s economy crippled. - **Loss Condition:**â€¯Allow EG to execute a clean **Bâ€‘site** on any map or give Haodong a 1v1 clutch â€“ the moment they win a clutch they swing momentum. --- ## ğŸ“‹ Roundâ€‘byâ€‘Round Protocol | Round | EG Trend | OUR Attack | OUR Defense | Primary Target | |-------|----------|------------|-------------|----------------| | **1 â€“ Pistol** | 37.5â€¯% win (defensive) | â€¢ **Aâ€‘site split** â€“ two entry frags (Viperâ€¯&â€¯Sova) + one midâ€‘control (Cypher)
â€¢ Early **smokeâ€‘wall** on Aâ€‘heaven to deny vision | â€¢ **Bâ€‘site stack** with two operators (Killjoy, Sage)
â€¢ **Midâ€‘watch** on Aâ€‘mid to catch aggressive pushes | **ZmjjKK** (duelist) | | **2â€‘3 â€“ Antiâ€‘Eco** | 50â€¯% win (eco) | â€¢ Play **longâ€‘range** (Operator, Marshal) from Aâ€‘heaven & Bâ€‘garage
â€¢ Avoid closeâ€‘angle fights; force them to overâ€‘extend | â€¢ **Twoâ€‘man Bâ€‘stack** with **utility** (smokes, molotov) to punish forced buys
â€¢ **Save** if pistol lost â€“ force 2â€‘round eco | **Haodong** (weak link) | | **4â€‘5 â€“ Fullâ€‘Buy** | 36.5â€¯% win (full) | â€¢ **Bâ€‘site early execute** on maps where they favor A (Icebox, Sunset)
â€¢ Use **Corrode** (if available) to block their midâ€‘push
â€¢ **Stack utility** on their preferred site to force a retake | â€¢ **Aâ€‘site hold** with **vertical angles** (Jett, Reyna)
â€¢ **Rotate** on 2â€‘second cue (smoke drop) | **ZmjjKK** | | **6+ â€“ Late Game** | Mixed | â€¢ **Force 5v4** by trading picks; **no solo plays**
â€¢ **Clamp** Haodong on rotations, deny clutch opportunities | â€¢ **Play for picks**; keep **controller alive** for smokes
â€¢ **Ecoâ€‘round safety** â€“ hold angles, donâ€™t overâ€‘commit | **Haodong** (clutch danger) | --- ## ğŸ”„ Critical IF/THEN Decision Tree - **Opening Duel** - **IF** we secure **first blood** â†’ **Play aggressive 5v4**;
